member_organisations:
The EEF has 2 categories of members:  
 
Active Members : these are Members of the European Parliament who wish to be directly involved in the EEF’s activities. 
http://www.europeanenergyforum.eu/members/active-members 
 
Associate Members : Associate Members are companies, research organizations, associations and regulators interested in energy-related problems and that want to be directly involved in the EEF's activities. 
http://www.europeanenergyforum.eu/members/associate-members
fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, External Relations, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Our association monitors dossiers related to energy issues.  All fields relating to energy are of interest to our neutral forum.  Our association also monitors environment and climate dossiers.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
The EEF promotes dialogue and exchange of views on all issues relating to energy through dinner-debates and some other events.  The aim is that MEPs, Industries and the European Commission can exchange views in a neutral place in order to be informed on energy issues. 
Dinner-debates and discussions take place in the European Parliament premises in Brussels or Strasbourg. They are held around two times per month. 
Visits aim at acquainting members with energy technologies used today. Occasionally, the EEF organises visits to energy sites from various EU Members States or from outside the EU. 
 
http://www.europeanenergyforum.eu/events
goals__remit:
The EEF events provide a place for discussion where EU actors in the energy sector can meet, get informed and debate and where all points of views and ideas are welcome. 
The EEF promotes the dialogue and the debate between different parties : MEPs, industry, civil servants, scientific community, … involved in energy issues through a variety of events (dinner-debates, lunchtime discussions, visits, …)  The EEF combines the proposals from its Associate Members with the interest of the Active Members (MEPs) in co-operation with the European Commission. 
The events are chaired by the President of the EEF who is an MEP.
